title: Quantitative Investigation of the Acceleration of a Cart on an Inclined Plane

cells.data:
D. Ben Knoble
PID: 730083304

Partners:

Experiment performed: 27th August 2018
Preliminary Report Submitted: 5 September 2018

## I. Abstract

We measured the distance $x$ travelled over time $t$ by a cart on an inclined plane at a constant but unknown angle $\theta$. We then analyzed the collected data to investigate a relationship between $x$ and $t$; namely, the acceleration $a$. As was predicted by kinematics models of constant acceleration, we found that $x \propto t^2$; that is, that the distance travelled is proportional to the square of the time. Our measured acceleration using this model was within expected values, being a fraction of the acceleration near Earth's surface $g$. We discussed the implications of friction on our measurements and acceleration values, and the probable dependence of $a$ on $\sin\theta$.
